title: Separate blocking and async APIs
body:
Hello again :)

Since my first contributions to this crate and now, I have learnt a lot more about how async Rust works, and I've realised we've made some mistakes I would like to fix...

Async functions should not be performing blocking operations. For example if you were building a GUI application, you would expect that when calling an async function it should not be blocking the CPU & event loop whilst waiting for monitors to update. 
See: https://ryhl.io/blog/async-what-is-blocking/

So we currently have problems in both:

- Linux: We are correctly calling the zbus async functions, but incorrecly doing blocking filesystem operations with `std::fs`
- Windows: The whole thing is blocking, since the Win32 C monitor API only provides blocking functions.

I propose we fix this by having a separate blocking and async API, in the same way that many other crates do such as [reqwest](https://docs.rs/reqwest/latest/reqwest/blocking/index.html) or [zbus](https://docs.rs/zbus/latest/zbus/blocking/index.html).

Having a blocking API is also much more convenient / ergonomic for users who are not intending to run within an async context.  

I recommend running `cargo doc` locally to get a quick overview of the changes!

(Note: I've tested the Windows side, but not the Linux side as I don't have a suitable device setup at the moment)
